001package net.tvburger.jdl.perceptron;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.datasets.LinesAndCircles;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Regime;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Trainer;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes.Regimes;
008
009import java.util.Arrays;
010
011public class Mark1 {
012
013    public static void main(String[] args) {
014        Perceptron mark1 = Perceptron.create(400, 512, 8);
015        mark1.accept(new PerceptronInitializer());
016
017        DataSet<Float> dataSet = new LinesAndCircles().load();
018        DataSet<Float> trainingSet = dataSet.subset(10, dataSet.size());
019        DataSet<Float> validationSet = dataSet.subset(0, 10);
020        Regime regime = Regimes.epochs(10).stochastic();
021        Trainer<Perceptron, Float> trainer = Trainer.of(new PerceptronInitializer(), null, new PerceptronUpdateRule(), regime);
022        trainer.train(mark1, trainingSet);
023
024        for (DataSet.Sample<Float> sample : validationSet) {
025            Float[] estimate = mark1.estimate(sample.features());
026            System.out.println("real = " + Arrays.toString(sample.targetOutputs()) + " estimated = " + Arrays.toString(estimate));
027        }
028    }
029
030}
